      • BasicDataDescriptor

        protected BasicDataDescriptor()
        Only for subclasses that know what they're doing

      • BasicDataDescriptor

        public BasicDataDescriptor(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        Creates a new BasicDataDescriptor from the given ByteBuffer. The ByteBuffer will be duplicated, so the position, etc. will not be modified by operations on BasicDataDescriptor. However, operations on the underlying buffer will affect the related buffer. The buffer's position must be 0 - if you want to use a subsection, slice the buffer before calling
        Parameters:
        data -

      • getData

        public int getData(java.nio.ByteBuffer destination,
          long srcOffset,
          int length,
          boolean release)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: DataDescriptor
        Reads some of the data from the descriptor
        Specified by:
        getData in interface DataDescriptor
        Parameters:
        destination - - buffer to read data into - data is written at the current buffer offset
        srcOffset - - offset in the source data
        length - - bytes to read
        release - - release the data descriptor after this read (cannot be used again after this is called)
        Returns:
        number of bytes read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isAccessible

        public boolean isAccessible()
        Description copied from interface: DataDescriptor
        Returns true if the data is currently accessible. Returns false if it is not. (For example, a data descriptor that is only locally accessible that is sent to a remote machine)
